name: le_two
statement: theorem le_two (x : MyNat) (hx : le x two) : x = zero ∨ x = one ∨ x = two := by
proof:
cases hx with c hc
rw [le_iff_exists_add] at hc
rw [two_eq_succ_one] at hc
cases hc with h
  -- Case 1: add x c = one
  have h1 : c = zero := by
    apply add_right_eq_self h
    exact zero_add x
  rw [h1] at h
  exact or.inr (one_eq_succ_zero)
  -- Case 2: add x c = two
  have h2 : c = one := by
    apply add_right_eq_self h
    exact zero_add x
  rw [h2] at h
  exact or.inr (two_eq_succ_one)
  -- Case 3: c > one leads to contradiction
  have h3 : c ≠ zero ∧ c ≠ one := by
    intro h4
    cases h4 with h4a h4b
    -- If c = zero, we have already handled this case
    -- If c = one, we have already handled this case
    contradiction

name: mul_eq_zero
statement: theorem mul_eq_zero (a b : MyNat) (h : mul a b = zero) : a = zero ∨ b = zero := by
proof:
cases a with
| zero =>
  left
  rfl
| succ a' =>
  cases b with
  | zero =>
    right
    rfl
  | succ b' =>
    have h' : mul (succ a') (succ b') ≠ zero := by
      apply mul_left_ne_zero
      intro h''
      rw [h''] at h
      exact zero_ne_succ _
    contradiction

name: mul_right_eq_self
statement: theorem mul_right_eq_self (a b : MyNat) (ha : a ≠ zero) (h : mul a b = a) : b = one := by
proof:
cases b with
| zero =>
  have h1 : mul a zero = zero := mul_zero a
  rw [h1] at h
  contradiction
| succ c =>
  rw [mul_succ a c] at h
  have : mul a c = a := by
    rw [h]
  have h2 : a = add (mul a c) a := by rw [add_succ, this]
  rw [h2] at h
  exact one_eq_succ_zero
